availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel "Hampton" Flanery (Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer and sgt & lieut 7th Ky Inf USA)

body.p: Jackson County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Son of James Flanery and Mary Minter Flanery. Married to Nancy A. Brandenburgh Flanery in Owsley County, Kentucky, on December 14, 1858. Farmer in Jackson County in 1860. Father of James H. Flanery, Lucy A. Flanery, and Mary J. Flanery. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first sergeant, second lieutenant, and first lieutenant from August 19, 1861, to May 4, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Virginia, Scott County, Western District, p. 395B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jackson County, My Division, p. 863.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Travellers Rest, p. 344A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027-994058, Owsley County Marriages, p. 7 of 21 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 212.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 756.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1964), KDLA, Roll #7016189, Owsley County Deaths, File #16791.
Find A Grave, "Samuel Hampton Flanery (1833-1927)," Memorial #111664373, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/111664373 (accessed July 29, 2020).
